Title: I'll Find You
Story by: Zbigniew John Raczynski  Edward Lee  Marcin Ziebinski  Ariadna Lewanska
Produced by: Bozenna Intrator   Lukasz Raczynski  Zbigniew John Raczynski  Fred Roos
Starring:
Adelaide Clemens 
 Leo Suter 
 Stephen Dorff 
 Connie Nielsen 
 Stellan Skarsgård
Edited by: Richard Chew  Eric A. Sears   Paul Seydor
Production companies: Music, War and Love   FR Production   Bovenkon
Plot: In 1939 Poland, Robert and Rachel are musical performers (an opera singer and a Jewish violin virtuoso, respectively) who dream of, one day, performing at Carnegie Hall. They are attracted to each other, but their differing faiths hinder it. However, the Nazi invasion of Poland and the arrival of the Second World War lead to the pair becoming separated, and Robert vows to find Rachel again, entering into Germany.
Cast:
Adelaide Clemens as Rachel Rubin
Ursula Parker as Young Rachel

Leo Suter as Robert Pulaski
Sebastian Croft  as Young Robert
Stephen Dorff as Wehrmacht General Huber
Connie Nielsen as Lena Moser Drabowski
Reception: Review aggregator website Rotten Tomatoes reports an approval rating of 85% based on 27 reviews, with an average rating of 6.60/10.
